intro: Cuatresia plowmanii, commonly known as the Plowman's quill, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, spiny stems and showy, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in the spring. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the plant typically grows in rocky or disturbed soils. Cuatresia plowmanii is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands.
